subject: using junit with an existing testing tool
msgSnippet: Hi all, Im currently using a very powerful test tool but the problem is that it produces unreadable results. It takes an input file executes all the attribute
messageBody:
Hi all,
Im currently using a very powerful test tool but the problem is that it
produces unreadable results. It takes an input file executes all the
attribute values and throws an exception if there is an error. There
are about 150+ of these files. To fix it up I wrapped it in Junit. Now
each executed file is treated as an individual test. This works great,
I have a nice gui telling me which testfiles passed and which failed.
The problem is that it doesnt tell me why they fail. the original
program still throws an exception but Junit cannot hear it. Is there
any way of directing the error to Junit? thanks Jonno
